name: Crystal Inn Brigham City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have spent two weeks on the road and have stayed in twelve hotels and this place is one of the best. The Crystal was clean and well maintained inside and out. Our room was quiet, spacious, and clean. We appreciated the HD tv with hundreds of channels and comfortable beds. The free continental breakfast had an array of food to pick from and ample room to sit and dine. I would recommend this place to anyone needed to stay in the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Bob, at the Front Desk was very professional, nice, fast and efficient. The hotel in general, and our room in particular, was very clean, nice new looking carpet and the best fragrance and odor free room we have rented. WIFI is easy to connect to. Wide-Flat screen TV. Linens clean and fresh smelling. Beds comfortable. Bathroom spotless. Some loud voices in the hall early in the evening, but no sounds coming through the walls, and no loud noises at all when it was time to go to sleep. Breakfast offered a variety of breakfast foods. The french toast was dry and musty tasting, but the sausage, biscuit and gravy were good. Checkout was a breeze. Overall extremely pleased with our stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: Stayed at the Crystal Inn in Brigham City for the new temple open house. The Brigham City area is still reeling from the economic depression since 2008. The hotel room was nice but the sheets on the pull-out couch bed were stained. We enjoyed breakfast but it is not as diverse as the breakfasts at other Crystal Inns (such as St. George). It is very convenient to the temple and the shopping in the area. We would stay there again on our next visit to BC. Hopefully, the temple will spur additional business for this lovely Wasatch front city.
reviews.title: Temple stay

reviews.text: We reserved a room for Aug. 3rd and 4th on June 8th. When we arrived the evening of Aug. 3rd (on our way to a family dinner for which we wanted to freshen up) we were told they could not find a reservation for us. When I produced a printed confirmation, we were told that reservation belonged to someone else with a different name. The desk clerk then happened to remember that my brother did not have a reservation so he checked into our room. Our last names are not the same. My husband was infuriated and confronted my brother in public. The desk clerk lied. My brother also had a reservation. The entire situation was embarrassing and upsetting in the extreme.
reviews.title: Reservation not honored

reviews.text: We stayed at the Crystal Inn for one night. It’s close enough to the freeway, but not so close you hear the traffic. We got to the hotel at 11:30pm and for security reasons the entrance to the hotel was locked and they have a number posted to call to have the night staff to come let you in. I understand the logic behind this but they are relying in people having a cell phone. Luckily we had one but when we called the number it just rang and rang. Thankfully the clerk was coming from down the hall and saw us at the door. He said his phone never rang. I think there needs to be a better way at getting into the building late at night. We could have been standing there for a long time if he hadn’t seen us. Not what we wanted after a 12 hour drive and at 11:30pm. The parking lot is small but we were able to find a spot easily.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but there are few issues management could fit to make it better!
Nice, yet dated and inconvenient
reviews.text: We stayed here one night on our way to Yellowstone. Our king room in this non-smoking establishment smelled like smoke, which was not acceptable. The front desk immediately offered either an air freshener or another room. We obviously took another room. The facility is clean and the rooms are spacious. However, this property is certainly not in compliance with the National American Disabilities Act (ADA). It is a two story property, with all rooms having interior entrances into the hallway and there is NO elevator.... only stairs. This did not effect us but certainly could to someone in a different situation with physical limitations.

We checked into this hotel around 11 pm on our way back from Yellow Stone National Park. Found the rooms quite large though the toilet was a wee bit smaller than the ones we had stayed in other hotels. The basins were placed in the bed room,not very convenient I thought. Overall experience was not too bad. In fact we were allowed free extended checkout by the lady at the reception.
reviews.title: Good stopover hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay here from the 1st shift personal to the last ,everyone is pleasant and truely helpful with your needs. They listen to you and your suggestions. Even the breakfast girl is attentive to you and very pleasant.
reviews.title: Tops in the town

reviews.text: We have stayed here a couple times and have been very pleased. Very clean rooms that are well maintained. We also have a pet and have had no issues with her here at all. Comfy beds and pillows. Both nights here there have been very nice and we would stay again, no problem.
reviews.title: Clean, bright, pleasant and very economical!

reviews.text: We stay at Crystal Inn's all the time. This is a very nice clean Hotel. Very nice rooms with lots of room and microwave and fridge. The staff is very good. Carla does a great job at the front desk.
reviews.title: Best Place to stay in Brigham City

reviews.text: I had a really pleasant experience here! The employees were exceptionally helpful and cheery. The room was clean and comfortable, with a fridge and microwave. I brought my dinner to go from a restaurant-- they forgot to include the utensils. The Desk clerk opened the breakfast area and let me choose what I needed -- not plastic ones either! Wish I had taken a swimsuit -- nice indoor pool and hot tub. I was only there one night, but if the other hotels in this chain are even half as pleasant as this one was, I'm a fan for life!
reviews.title: Best for the price!

reviews.text: We made an unplanned stop here and were delighted with the service and value. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful -we needed to fax some urgent papers and they didn't hesitate to assist us. Breakfast was good - hot and cold options. Our kids loved that the pool was available 24hours. I would definitely stay here again and my check out other Crystal Inns now that I have had this experience.
reviews.title: Very happy to have stumbled upon this hotel

reviews.text: Hotel was nice and clean and the staff was very friendly-snacks available in breakfast room after hours. Close to Walmart and other businesses-easy to get to-would stay there again-good price, very comfortable beds. I liked the separate seating area with couch-was easy for many to watch TV either on couch or bed. We've used many spa's but this one was hotter than others. Free newspaper.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very clean and looked new. It was roomy with a king sized bed with a separate space with couch. Had a microwave, small refrigerator and cofeemaker. Nice television and lots of channels. Breakfast was pretty good . Indoor pool and hot tub looked nice although we didn't use. Free newspaper was appreciated
reviews.title: Very nice room, good amenities

reviews.text: I stayed at the Crystal Inn a week a month for over 3 year. The last several months the hotel has done nothing but decline. I will not stay here again. They ask for your opinion and then never respond or make any changes based on reviews. Management used to be fantastic - but since Chris left - Ick. The rooms now smell like cigarettes and mold.
reviews.title: Used to like; now not so much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel/motel; clean, quiet and reasonably priced. The staff was VERY helpful in suggesting nearby restaurants, etc. We would stay there again NO PROBLEM!!
reviews.title: Clean & Quiet

reviews.text: Pool looked inviting we were too tired to take advantage though.
reviews.title: Great Accommodation for Our Needs

reviews.text: BREAKFAST was amazing! Not your typical motel breakfast - HOT scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles and more! Fruit, cereal, juices the whole enchilada - WHAT A VALUE!!!
reviews.title: Not the cleanest rooms!

reviews.text: This is the second time that my wife and I have stayed at this particular Crystal Inn for over a week each time, and will stay there again when in the area. Our king-bed room was clean and very large as hotel rooms go. We were very confortable there, and it is close to shops, fast food, restaurants, etc. The pool and hot tub were nice, even though the exercise room was fairly small - but useable. All the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, always smiling, asking if we were enjoying our stay, if they could do anything for us, and if we needed anything. The hot breakfast was good - served from 0630-0930 on weekdays, and beginning at 0700 on Weekends, and the ladies there were very helpful and pleasant. Even on a day when we had to leave the hotel early, we went to the breakfast area about 15 minutes prior to "opening time" and things were all ready. We also enjoyed the location of the hotel - conveniently located, but a little more "off the beaten path" (away from the interstate) than some of the other hotels in the area. If you are in the Brigham City area - this is a nice plast to stay. (R. Franklin/Maryland)
reviews.title: Large room but breakfast was too late

reviews.text: I choose this Crystal Inn because i have stayed at several other Crystal Inn hotels many times. I have always been happy with Crystal Inns. This was not the nicest one I have stayed in. I arrived at the hotel. Staff were friendly. The staff stated their cleaning crew was the best. So I thought that's great. However my room was not very clean. I found lots of dust and bathroom floor did not look clean. I was to tired to care and went to bed once I made sure it was clean. Breakfast was OK. But not the normal breakfast you would expect from Crystal Inn.
reviews.title: Brigham City Crystal INN Nice!
